body: Stops the execution of a list of ACTIONS in a RULE.
title: Abort

body:
Stops the execution of a list of ACTIONS in a RULE if the provided Bool is True. Otherwise, the execution continues with the remaining ACTIONS.
Inputs Bool
title: AbortIf

body:
Returns the unsigned value of the provided Number input.
Inputs Number Output Number
title: AbsoluteValue

body:
Returns the sum of two Number or two Vector values.
Inputs Number | Vector Number | Vector Output Number | Vector
title: Add

body:
Returns a Bool value based on whether both of the provided inputs return True.
Inputs Bool Bool Output Bool
title: And

body:
Returns the angle (in degrees) between two provided Vector values.
Inputs Vector Vector Output Number
title: AngleBetweenVectors

body:
Returns the difference between two angles (in degrees).
Inputs Number (1st Angle) Number (2nd Angle) Output Number
title: AngleDifference

body:
Returns a copy of an Array with the provided value appended to the end.
Note: It is not possible for an array to contain arrays. Attempting to append an array to an array will concatenate them instead.
Inputs Array Any Type Output Array
title: AppendToArray

body:
Applies the effect of a medical gadget to a target Player.
Inputs Player MedGadgetTypesItem
title: ApplyMedGadget

body:
Returns the inverse cosine of a provided Number value in degrees.
Inputs Number Output Number
title: ArccosineInDegrees

body:
Returns the inverse cosine of a provided Number value in radians.
Inputs Number Output Number
title: ArccosineInRadians

body:
Returns the inverse sine of a provided Number value in degrees.
Inputs Number Output Number
title: ArcsineInDegrees

body:
Returns the inverse sine of a provided Number value in radians.
Inputs Number Output Number
title: ArcsineInRadians

body:
Returns the inverse tangent of a provided Number value in degrees.
Inputs Number Output Number
title: ArctangentInDegrees

body:
Returns the inverse tangent of a provided Number value in radians.
Inputs Number Output Number
title: ArctangentInRadians

body:
Returns a Bool value based on whether the provided Array contains the provided value.
Inputs Array Any Type Output Bool
title: ArrayContains

body:
Returns a copy of the specified Array containing only values from a specified index range.
Inputs Array Number (Start Index) Number (Count) Output Array
title: ArraySlice

body:
Returns the backward directional Vector of (0, 0, 1).
Output Vector
title: BackwardVector

body:
A Bool is fancy game developer talk for a True or False value. This type is used to define or identify the state of a variety of things.
Is a player currently prone?
Is the player using a specific soldier?
Can players not score points because of some custom condition?
title: Bool

body: Breaks and exits the execution of a looping block, such as While or LoopVariable.
title: Break

body:
Sets the capturing time for target CapturePoint to the provided Number.
Inputs CapturePoint Number
title: CapturePointCapturingTime

body:
Sets the neutralization time for target CapturePoint to the provided Number.
Inputs CapturePoint Number
title: CapturePointNeutralizationTime

body:
Returns a CapturePointsItem from the collection of all possible capture points.
Output CapturePointsItem
title: CapturePoints

body:
Clears all custom messages for a provided Player or TeamId. If no Player or TeamId is provided, it will clear all custom messages for everyone.
Inputs Player | TeamId (Group) Optional
title: ClearAllCustomMessages

body:
Clears text from the provided CustomMessageSlotsItem for the provided Player or TeamId. If no Player or TeamId is given, it clears all players text at that CustomMessageSlotsItem.
Inputs CustomMessageSlotsItem Player | TeamId (Group) Optional
title: ClearCustomMessage

body:
Returns the closest alive Player to a provided position. Can be filtered using a TeamId.
Note: If no players are alive when this block is called, the returned Player will be invalid.
Inputs Vector (Position) TeamId Optional Output Player
title: ClosestPlayerTo

body:
Returns a Bool indicating if the target CapturePoint has the same designation as the provided CapturePointsItem.
Inputs CapturePoint CapturePointsItem Output Bool
title: CompareCapturePoint

body:
Returns a Bool indicating if the target Vehicle has the same name as the provided VehiclesItem or if it is the same type as the provided VehicleTypesItem.
Inputs Vehicle VehiclesItem | VehicleTypesItem Output Bool
title: CompareVehicleName

body:
Evaluates the condition to run a RULE or SUBROUTINE block based on the Bool input.
Inputs Bool
title: CONDITION

body: Forces the execution of a looping block (such as While or LoopVariable) to the start of the next iteration of that block.
title: Continue

body:
The start of a conditional control block whose ACTIONS will execute if its condition is True.
Inputs Bool
title: Control_If

body:
Returns the cosine value of a specified angle in degrees.
Inputs Number Output Number
title: CosineFromDegrees

body:
Returns the cosine value of a specified angle in radians.
Inputs Number Output Number
title: CosineFromRadians

body:
Returns the Number of elements in the specified Array.
Inputs Array Output Number
title: CountOf

body:
Returns a Vector composed of three provided ‘X’ (left), ‘Y’ (up), and ‘Z’ (forward) values.
Inputs Number (X Value) Number (Y Value) Number (Z Value) Output Vector
title: CreateVector

body:
Returns the cross product between two Vector values. If the two Vector inputs are parallel, the result will be zero.
Inputs Vector Vector Output Vector
title: CrossProduct

body:
Returns a reference to the current Array element being evaluated. Only used for FilteredArray, MappedArray, SortedArray, IsTrueForAll, and IsTrueForAny.
Output Any Type
title: CurrentArrayElement

body:
Returns a CustomMessageSlotsItem which can be used with DisplayCustomMessage and ClearCustomMessage to display information on screen to players.
Output CustomMessageSlotsItem
title: CustomMessageSlot

body:
Returns a DamageTypesItem from the collection of all possible damage types.
Output DamageTypesItem
title: DamageTypes

body:
Damages the target Vehicle by the provided Number amount.
Inputs Vehicle Number
title: DamageVehicle

body:
Deals a provided amount of damage to a target Player by a another Player.
Inputs Player (Target) Number Player (Giver) Optional
title: DealDamage

body:
Returns a DeathTypesItem from the collection of all possible death types.
Output DeathTypesItem
title: DeathTypes

body:
Displays debug text for testing script.
Inputs String
title: DebugMessage

body: Force spawns all players in the deploy screen.
title: DeployAllPlayers

body:
Deploys a target Player onto the battlefield from the deploy screen.
Inputs Player
title: DeployPlayer

body:
Destroys the target Vehicle.
Inputs Vehicle
title: DestroyVehicle

body:
Returns a directional Vector from the provided horizontal (yaw) and vertical (pitch) angles (in degrees).
Inputs Number (Horizontal) Number (Vertical) Output Vector
title: DirectionFromAngles

body:
Returns the direction, or normalized Vector, from a starting position and ending position.
Inputs Vector (Starting Position) Vector (Ending Position) Output Vector
title: DirectionTowards

body:
Display a Message on-screen in the upper right corner. Using the CustomMessageSlotsItem, this Message can be displayed on multiple lines. It will stay up for the length of the provided duration, or stay up indefinitely if a negative Number is provided. It will be displayed to everyone unless a specific Player or TeamId is provided.
Note: It’s your responsibility to ensure a safe and fair experience for others, violating the EA User Agreement by using offensive or inappropriate text may result in account bans.
Inputs Message CustomMessageSlotsItem Number (Duration) Player | TeamId (Group) Optional
title: DisplayCustomMessage

body:
Displays a Message on the top center of the screen for 6 seconds. If no target is provided, the Message will display to everyone.
Note: This will only appear to players that are deployed on the map. It’s your responsibility to ensure a safe and fair experience for others, violating the EA User Agreement by using offensive or inappropriate text may result in account bans.
Inputs Message Player | TeamId Optional
title: DisplayGameModeMessage

body:
Displays a Message on the world log above the minimap for 6 seconds. If no target is provided, it will display the Message to everyone.
Note: This will only appear to players that are deployed on the map. It’s your responsibility to ensure a safe and fair experience for others, violating the EA User Agreement by using offensive or inappropriate text may result in account bans.
Inputs Message Player | TeamId Optional
title: DisplayHighlightedWorldLogMessage

body:
Displays a notification-type Message on the top-right of the screen for 6 seconds. If no target is provided, it will display the Message to everyone.
Note: It’s your responsibility to ensure a safe and fair experience for others, violating the EA User Agreement by using offensive or inappropriate text may result in account bans.
Inputs Message Player | TeamId Optional
title: DisplayNotificationMessage

body:
Returns the distance between a starting position and ending position.
Inputs Vector (Starting Position) Vector (Ending Position) Output Number
title: DistanceBetween

body:
Returns the ratio between two Number values or a Vector and Number value. A Vector divided by a Number will yield a scaled Vector.
Inputs Number | Vector Number Output Number | Vector
title: Divide

body:
Returns the dot product between two Vector values. If the two values are orthogonal to each other, the result will be zero.
Inputs Vector Vector Output Number
title: DotProduct

body:
Returns the downward directional Vector of (0, -1, 0).
Output Vector
title: DownVector

body: The start of a block of ACTIONS that will execute if all previous If and ElseIf conditions are False.
title: Else

body:
The start of a block of ACTIONS that will run if its condition is True and all previous If or ElseIf conditions are False.
Inputs Bool
title: ElseIf

body:
Returns an initialized empty Array.
Output Array
title: EmptyArray

body:
Enables or disables all keyboard and mouse inputs - such as movement, firing, and turning - for a target Player.
Inputs Player Bool
title: EnableAllInputRestrictions

body:
Enables or disables spawning from the deploy screen for all players.
Inputs Bool
title: EnableAllPlayerDeploy

body:
Enables or disables deploying on provided CapturePoint for the team that owns it.
Inputs CapturePoint Bool
title: EnableCapturePointDeploying

body:
Enables or disables capturing a provided CapturePoint.
Inputs CapturePoint Bool
title: EnableCapturing

body:
Enables or disables default gamemode scoring logic, which refers to the base gamemode’s scoring rules. For instance, disabling this rule will remove ticket bleed from Conquest or add one point for kills in Free-for-All. Disable this if you want to implement your own custom scoring logic.
Inputs Bool
title: EnableDefaultGameModeScoring

body:
Enables or disables the gamemode’s default win condition logic. The win condition is checked when the time limit is reached or when a team or player reaches the target score. Disable this if you want to trigger your own win condition.
Inputs Bool
title: EnableDefaultGameModeWinCondition

body:
Enables or disables the provided CapturePoint or MCOM.
Note: MCOMs are only available on TDM, VTDM, and Custom Conquest layouts.
Inputs CapturePoint | MCOM Bool
title: EnableGameModeObjective

body:
Enables or disables a headquarters specified by the provided TeamId and Number index.
Note: The index begins counting at 0.
Inputs TeamId Number (Index) Bool
title: EnableHQ

body:
Enables or disables a specified InputRestrictionsItem on a target Player.
Inputs Player InputRestrictionsItem Bool
title: EnableInputRestriction

body:
Enables or disables the ability for a target Player to deploy.
Inputs Player Bool
title: EnablePlayerDeploy

body:
Enables or disables ticket bleed acceleration for both teams. Ticket bleed acceleration is on by default and only comes into effect if one team owns all sectors for about 60 seconds.
Inputs Bool
title: EnableTicketBleedAcceleration

body:
Enables or disables the gamemode voice-over (VO) text and audio messaging, such as announcements about sector majority and capture points.
Note: This function is enabled by default.
Inputs Bool
title: EnableVOMessaging

body:
Enables or disables the image for a provided WorldIconsItem.
Inputs WorldIconsItem Bool
title: EnableWorldIconImage

body:
Enables or disables the text for a provided WorldIconsItem.
Note: There is no default text, and will need to be set before or after this property is enabled to appear.
Inputs WorldIconsItem Bool
title: EnableWorldIconText

body:
Ends the current gamemode and designates the provided Player or TeamId as the winner. The gamemode ends in draw if TeamId is set to 0.
Inputs TeamId | Player
title: EndGameMode

body:
Returns a Bool indicating if two values are equal to each other.
Inputs Any Type Any Type Output Bool
title: Equals

body:
Returns the CapturePoint payload from the RULE EVENT context.
Output CapturePoint
title: EventCapturePoint

body:
Returns the DamageType of the victim from the OnPlayerDamaged EVENT context.
Output DamageType
title: EventDamageType

body:
Returns the DeathType of the victim from the OnPlayerDied or OnPlayerEarnedKill EVENT context.
Output DeathType
title: EventDeathType

body:
Returns a MCOM payload from the RULE EVENT context.
Output MCOM
title: EventMCOM

body:
Returns the 2nd Player payload from the RULE EVENT context.
Output Player
title: EventOtherPlayer

body:
Returns the 1st Player payload from the RULE EVENT context.
Output Player
title: EventPlayer

body:
Returns the Number seat index payload of a Vehicle from the RULE EVENT context.
Output Number
title: EventSeat

body:
Returns the TeamId payload from the Ongoing Team EVENT context.
Output TeamId
title: EventTeam

body:
Returns the Vehicle payload from the RULE EVENT context.
Output Vehicle
title: EventVehicle

body:
Returns the HardwareId of the weapon used to kill the victim from the OnPlayerDied or OnPlayerEarnedKill EVENT context.
Output HardwareId
title: EventWeapon

body:
Returns a FactionsItem from the collection of all available factions.
Output FactionsItem
title: Factions

body:
Returns the farthest alive Player from a provided position. Can be filtered using a TeamId.
Note: If no players are alive when this block is called, the returned Player will be invalid.
Inputs Vector (Position) TeamId Optional Output Player
title: FarthestPlayerFrom

body:
Returns a filtered version of the specified Array based on the condition provided. This block cycles through the entire array. You can utilize the CurrentArrayElement block to represent the element in the Array for each iteration. For an Array like GetPlayers, CurrentArrayElement would represent each Player in that Array. You can then build your filter condition based on a property of that Player (like score, or some custom player Variable value).
Inputs Array Any Type Output Array
title: FilteredArray

body:
Returns the first value of the specified Array.
Inputs Array Output Any Type
title: FirstOf

body:
Forces all players to exit the target Vehicle.
Inputs Vehicle
title: ForceAllExitVehicle

body:
Puts the target Player into the mandown state (unless mandown is disabled).
Inputs Player
title: ForceMandown

body:
Forces the specified Player to exit the target Vehicle.
Inputs Player Vehicle
title: ForcePlayerExitVehicle

body:
Forces the specified Player into the target Vehicle at the provided seat Number.
Note: If the provided index is -1, that Player will be forced into the first available seat.
Inputs Player Vehicle Number
title: ForcePlayerToSeat

body:
Revives a target Player that is in the mandown state.
Inputs Player
title: ForceRevive

body:
Forces the target Player to switch to the provided PlayerInventorySlotsItem.
Inputs Player PlayerInventorySlotsItem
title: ForceSwitchInventory

body:
Returns the forward directional Vector of (0, 0, -1).
Output Vector
title: ForwardVector

body:
Returns an Array of all capture points within a game.
Output Array
title: GetAllCapturePoints

body:
Returns an Array of all MCOMs within a game.
Output Array
title: GetAllMCOMs

body:
Returns a Array of all players inside a provided Vehicle
Inputs Vehicle Output Array
title: GetAllPlayersInVehicle

body:
Returns an Array of all vehicles within a game.
Output Array
title: GetAllVehicles

body:
Returns the in-world position of the provided CapturePoint.
Inputs CapturePoint Output Vector
title: GetCapturePointPosition

body:
Returns a Number from zero to one corresponding to the capture progress of the provided CapturePoint.
Inputs CapturePoint Output Number
title: GetCaptureProgress

body:
Returns the current owner TeamId corresponding to the provided CapturePoint.
Inputs CapturePoint Output TeamId
title: GetCurrentOwnerTeamID

body:
Returns the current gamemode score of the provided Player or TeamId.
Inputs Player | TeamId Output Number
title: GetGameModeScore

body:
Returns the gamemode target score needed for victory.
Output Number
title: GetGameModeTargetScore

body:
Returns the total elapsed time of the current gamemode.
Output Number
title: GetGameModeTimeElapsed

body:
Returns the time limit set for the gamemode (in seconds).
Output Number
title: GetGameModeTimeLimit

body:
Returns the amount of time left (seconds) in the current gamemode.
Output Number
title: GetGameModeTimeRemaining

body:
Returns the target Player loaded ammo of the provided PlayerInventorySlotsItem.
Inputs Player PlayerInventorySlotsItem Output Number
title: GetInventoryAmmo

body:
Returns the target Player magazine ammo of the provided PlayerInventorySlotsItem.
Inputs Player PlayerInventorySlotsItem Output Number
title: GetInventoryMagazineAmmo

body:
Returns the value of the target MCOM state.
Inputs MCOM MCOMStateBoolItem Output Bool
title: GetMCOMState

body:
Returns the CapturePoint or MCOM corresponding to the provided CapturePointsItem or MCOMsItem respectively.
Inputs CapturePointsItem Output CapturePoint
title: GetObjective

body:
Returns the TeamId of the team currently capturing the provided CapturePoint.
Inputs CapturePoint Output TeamId
title: GetOwnerProgressTeamID

body:
Returns the total amount of deaths for the target Player.
Inputs Player Output Number
title: GetPlayerDeaths

body:
Returns the Player currently occupying the provided seat index Number of the provided Vehicle.
Note: If no players are in the vehicle seat when this block is called, the returned Player will be invalid.
Inputs Vehicle Number Output Player
title: GetPlayerFromVehicleSeat

body:
Returns the total amount of kills for the target Player.
Inputs Player Output Number
title: GetPlayerKills

body:
Returns an Array of all players within a game.
Output Array
title: GetPlayers

body:
Returns a Array of all players within the boundaries of a provided CapturePoint.
Inputs CapturePoint Output Array
title: GetPlayersOnPoint

body:
Returns the value of the target Player state.
Inputs Player PlayerStateBoolItem | PlayerStateNumberItem | PlayerStateVectorItem Output Bool | Number | Vector
title: GetPlayerState

body:
Returns the seat index Number for the target Player if they are in a vehicle, otherwise returns -1.
Inputs Player Output Number
title: GetPlayerVehicleSeat

body:
Returns the previous owner TeamId corresponding to the provided CapturePoint.
Inputs CapturePoint Output TeamId
title: GetPreviousOwnerTeamID

body:
Returns the remaining fuse time (in seconds) on the provided MCOM.
Inputs MCOM Output Number
title: GetRemainingFuseTime

body:
Returns the Number of seats in a Vehicle.
Inputs Vehicle Output Number
title: GetSeatCount

body:
Returns the value of the argument that is passed into the SUBROUTINE. The list of available parameters will populate once this block is placed inside the SUBROUTINE.
Output Any Type
title: GetSubroutineArgument

body:
Returns the TeamId value of the specified Player OR the corresponding TeamId of the provided Number.
Inputs Player | Number Output TeamId
title: GetTeamId

body:
Returns the value of a Variable.
Inputs Variable Output Any Type
title: GetVariable

body:
Returns the Vehicle used by a Player.
Inputs Player Output Vehicle
title: GetVehicleFromPlayer

body:
Returns the value of the target Vehicle state.
Inputs Vehicle VehicleStateVectorItem Output Vector
title: GetVehicleState

body:
Returns the TeamId of the provided Vehicle.
Note: A Vehicle that is not occupied will have a neutral TeamId.
Inputs Vehicle Output TeamId
title: GetVehicleTeamId

body:
Returns the ‘X’ component of a provided Vector.
Inputs Vector Output Number
title: GetXComponent

body:
Returns the ‘Y’ component of a provided Vector.
Inputs Vector Output Number
title: GetYComponent

body:
Returns the ‘Z’ component of a provided Vector.
Inputs Vector Output Number
title: GetZComponent

body:
Returns a Bool indicating if the 1st provided value is greater than the 2nd provided value.
Inputs Number Number Output Bool
title: GreaterThan

body:
Returns a Bool indicating if the 1st provided value is greater than the 2nd provided value.
Inputs Number Number Output Bool
title: GreaterThanEqualTo

body:
Returns a Bool indicating if the provided Player has the specified ability.
Inputs Player InventoryPrimaryWeaponsItem | InventorySecondaryWeaponsItem | InventoryCharacterSpecialtiesItem | InventoryOpenGadgetsItem | InventoryThrowablesItem | InventoryMeleeWeaponsItem Output Bool
title: HasInventory

body:
Instantly adds a given amount of health to the target Player applied by a healer Player.
Note: When healing a player with a max health multiplier not equal to 1, the amount of health they receive will scale with their max health multiplier value.
Inputs Player (Target) Number Player (Healer) Optional
title: Heal

body: A special block which evaluates conditions to control the flow of ACTIONS in the If, Else If, and Else branches.
title: If

body:
Returns the 1st provided value if the condition is True, otherwise, returns the 2nd provided value.
Inputs Bool Any Type (Output Value if the Condition is True) Any Type (Output Value if the Condition is False) Output Any Type
title: IfThenElse

body:
Returns the index of an Array value.
Inputs Array Any Type Output Number
title: IndexOfArrayValue

body:
Returns a InputRestrictionsItem from the collection of all inputs which can be restricted with EnableInputRestriction.
Output InputRestrictionsItem
title: InputRestrictions

body:
Returns an InventoryCharacterSpecialtiesItem from the collection of all character specialties.
Output InventoryCharacterSpecialtiesItem
title: InventoryCharacterSpecialties

body:
Returns an InventoryMeleeWeaponsItem from the collection of all melee weapons.
Output InventoryMeleeWeaponsItem
title: InventoryMeleeWeapons

body:
Returns an InventoryOpenGadgetsItem from the collection of all open gadgets.
Output InventoryOpenGadgetsItem
title: InventoryOpenGadgets

body:
Returns an InventoryPrimaryWeaponsItem from the collection of all primary weapons.
Output InventoryPrimaryWeaponsItem
title: InventoryPrimaryWeapons

body:
Returns an InventorySecondaryWeaponsItem from the collection of all secondary weapons.
Output InventorySecondaryWeaponsItem
title: InventorySecondaryWeapons

body:
Returns a InventoryThrowablesItem from the collection of all throwables.
Output InventoryThrowablesItem
title: InventoryThrowables

body:
Returns True if the provided MapsItem is the name of the current map.
Inputs MapsItem Output Bool
title: IsCurrentMap

body:
Returns True if the provided TeamId is using soldiers from the specified FactionsItem.
Inputs TeamId FactionsItem Output Bool
title: IsFaction

body:
Returns True whether or not the active inventory slot of the target Player is the provided PlayerInventorySlotsItem.
Inputs Player PlayerInventorySlotsItem Output Bool
title: IsInventorySlotActive

body:
Returns a Bool indicating if the given HardwareId is equivalent to the provided ability.
Inputs HardwareId InventoryPrimaryWeaponsItem | InventorySecondaryWeaponsItem | InventoryCharacterSpecialtiesItem | InventoryOpenGadgetsItem | InventoryThrowablesItem | InventoryMeleeWeaponsItem Output Bool
title: IsKillerWeapon

body:
Returns a Bool indicating if the target Player is a specified PlayerSoldiersItem.
Inputs Player PlayerSoldiersItem
title: IsPlayerUsingSoldier

body:
Returns True if the provided Player is valid.
Inputs Player Output Bool
title: IsPlayerValid

body:
Returns True if the provided condition is True for every element in the provided Array.
Inputs Array Bool Output Bool
title: IsTrueForAll

body:
Returns True if the provided condition is True for at least one element in the provided Array.
Inputs Array Bool Output Bool
title: IsTrueForAny

body:
Returns True if the provided value is equal to the specified TypesItem.
Inputs Any Type TypesItem Output Bool
title: IsType

body:
Returns a Bool indicating if the target Vehicle is a occupied by a player.
Inputs Vehicle Output Bool
title: IsVehicleOccupied

body:
Returns a Bool indicating if the target seat index Number of target Vehicle is a occupied by a player.
Inputs Vehicle Number Output Bool
title: IsVehicleSeatOccupied

body:
Returns a Bool indicating if the victim was damaged by the provided DamageType.
Inputs DamageType DamageTypesItem Output Bool
title: IsVictimDamageType

body:
Returns a Bool indicating if the victim died by the provided DeathType.
Inputs DeathType DeathTypesItem Output Bool
title: IsVictimDeathType

body:
Kills a target Player (skips the Mandown state).
Inputs Player
title: Kill

body:
Returns the value at the end of the specified Array.
Inputs Array Output Any Type
title: LastOf

body:
Returns the leftward directional Vector of (-1, 0, 0).
Output Vector
title: LeftVector

body:
Returns a Bool indicating if the 1st provided value is less than the 2nd provided value.
Inputs Number Number Output Bool
title: LessThan

body:
Returns a Bool indicating if the 1st provided value is less than or equal to the 2nd provided value.
Inputs Number Number Output Bool
title: LessThanEqualTo

body:
Converts the provided local Player position to the corresponding position in the world space.
Inputs Vector (Local Position) Player Output Vector (World Position)
title: LocalToWorldPosition

body:
Converts the provided local Player vector to the corresponding vector in the world space.
Inputs Vector (Local Vector) Player Output Vector (World Vector)
title: LocalToWorldVector

body:
Returns a LocationalSoundsItem from the collection of locational sounds.
Output LocationalSoundsItem
title: LocationalSounds

body:
The start of a series of ACTIONS that will execute in a loop, modifying the control variable on each iteration. If the control Variable reaches or passes the range end value, the loop exits, and execution continues through the remaining ACTIONS in the RULE.
Inputs Variable Number (Start) Number (End) Number (Interval)
title: LoopVariable

body:
Returns a copy of the provided Array with the values evaluated using the mapped expression provided. The following example utilizes the GetPlayers Array with GetGameModeScore and CurrentArrayElement to return an Array of Player scores.
Inputs Array Any Type (Mapped Expression) Output Array
title: MappedArray

body:
Returns a MapsItem from the collection of all maps.
Output MapsItem
title: Maps

body:
Returns the greater of the two Number values provided.
Inputs Number Number Output Number
title: Max

body:
Returns a MCOMsItem from the collection of all possible MCOMs.
Output MCOMsItem
title: MCOMs

body:
Returns the MCOMStateBoolItem of the selected Bool-based MCOM property.
Output Bool
title: MCOMStateBool

body:
Returns a MedGadgetTypesItem from the collection of medical gadget types which can be used with the ApplyMedGadget.
Output MedGadgetTypesItem
title: MedGadgetTypes

body:
Returns a constructed Message object which can be used with DisplayGameModeMessage, DisplayNotificationMessage, DisplayHighlightedWorldLogMessage, and DisplayCustomMessage. The Message object is created by providing a Number, Player, or format String (which can take up to 3 format items).
A format String is a String that contains {} (called braces) within them, which can be substituted for parameters. For example, the String - {} gained {} points! - can be given a Player and Number parameter and could output as John gained 2 points!. See the example below for how this can be used with blocks.
Note: It’s your responsibility to ensure a safe and fair experience for others, violating the EA User Agreement by using offensive or inappropriate text may result in account bans.
Inputs String | Number | Player String | Number | Player Optional String | Number | Player Optional String | Number | Player Optional Output Message
title: Message

body: Anything you want to work within your custom gamemode must be placed inside this block. You can put blocks you’re working on outside of this block but they will not be executed. You can utilize the space outside the MOD block as a brainstorming area.
title: Mod

body:
Returns the remainder of the 1st provided value divided by the 2nd provided value.
Inputs Number Number Output Number
title: Modulo

body:
Returns the product of two Number values or the product of a Vector and Number value.
Inputs Number | Vector Number Output Number | Vector
title: Multiply

body:
Returns a unit-length normalization of a Vector.
Inputs Vector Output Vector
title: Normalize

body:
Return a Bool of the opposite value of the Bool input.
Inputs Bool Output Bool
title: Not

body:
Returns a Bool indicating if two values are not equal to each other.
Inputs Any Type Any Type Output Bool
title: NotEqualTo

body:
You can enter any numerical value you want here.
1, 2, 3.14, -10.2
Use this block in combination with math blocks to do all sorts of fun mathematical equations.
title: Number

body:
Returns a Bool based on whether either of the two inputs are True.
Inputs Bool Bool Output Bool
title: Or

body:
Pauses or unpauses the gamemode timer based on the provided Bool input.
Inputs Bool
title: PauseGameModeTime

body:
Returns a PlayerInventorySlotsItem from the collection of all available player inventory slots.
Output PlayerInventorySlotsItem
title: PlayerInventorySlots

body:
Returns a PlayerSoldiersItem from a list of all soldiers.
Output PlayerSoldiersItem
title: PlayerSoldiers

body:
Returns the PlayerStateBoolItem of the selected Bool-based player property.
Output PlayerStateBoolItem

body:
RULE blocks are triggered from an in-game EVENT. When an EVENT triggers, this block will check if its CONDITION has been met and then execute all of the ACTIONS.
Types of RULE Blocks Events Ongoing Ongoing EVENT types continually check if its CONDITION has become True. If so, the ACTIONS will be executed once. In order for the EVENT to execute again, the CONDITION must become False before becoming True again.
Ongoing EVENT types currently exist within the context of:
Global Player Team Vehicle CapturePoint Within the Player and Team contexts, payload value blocks, such as EventPlayer and EventTeam, can be used to refer to the specific Player or Team within the EVENT. Note: In FFA, Ongoing Team will not execute at all. OnPlayerDied This will trigger whenever a Player dies. Payloads: EventPlayer (Victim), EventOtherPlayer (Killer), EventDeathType (Victim Death Type), EventWeapon (Killing Weapon) OnPlayerDeployed This will trigger whenever a Player deploys. Payloads: EventPlayer (Deployed Player) OnPlayerJoinGame This will trigger when a Player joins the game. Payloads: EventPlayer (Joined Player) OnPlayerLeaveGame This will trigger when any player leaves the game. OnPlayerEarnedKill This will trigger when a Player earns a kill against another Player. Payloads: EventPlayer (Killer), EventOtherPlayer (Victim), EventDeathType (Victim Death Type), EventWeapon (Killing Weapon) OnGameModeEnding This will trigger when the gamemode ends. OnMandown This will trigger when a Player is forced into the mandown state. Payloads: EventPlayer (Downed Player) OnRevived This will trigger when a Player is revived by another Player. Payloads: EventPlayer (Revived Player), EventOtherPlayer (Reviver Player) OnTimeLimitReached This will trigger when the gamemode time limit has been reached. OnGameModeStarted This will trigger at the start of the gamemode. OnPlayerUndeploy This will trigger when the Player dies and returns to the deploy screen. Payloads: EventPlayer (Dead Player) OnVehicleDeployed This will trigger when a Vehicle is called into the map. Payloads: EventVehicle (Spawned Vehicle) OnVehicleDestroyed This will trigger when a Vehicle is destroyed. Payloads: EventVehicle (Destroyed Vehicle) OnPlayerEnterVehicle This will trigger when a Player enters a Vehicle. Payloads: EventPlayer (Player Who Enters), EventVehicle (Vehicle) OnPlayerExitVehicle This will trigger when a Player exits a Vehicle. Payloads: EventPlayer (Player Who Exits), EventVehicle (Vehicle) OnPlayerEnterVehicleSeat This will trigger when a Player enters a Vehicle seat. Payloads: EventPlayer (Player Who Enters Seat), EventVehicle (Vehicle), EventSeat (Seat Index) OnPlayerExitVehicleSeat This will trigger when a Player exits a Vehicle seat. Payloads: EventPlayer (Player Who Exits Seat), EventVehicle (Vehicle), EventSeat (Seat Index) OnCapturePointCaptured This will trigger when a team takes control of a CapturePoint. Payloads: EventCapturePoint (Captured Capture Point) OnCapturePointCapturing This will trigger when a team begins capturing a CapturePoint. Payloads: EventCapturePoint (Capture Point Being Captured) OnCapturePointLost This will trigger when a team loses control of a CapturePoint. Payloads: EventCapturePoint (Lost Capture Point) OnCapturePointNeutralizing This will trigger when a team begins neutralizing a CapturePoint. Payloads: EventCapturePoint (Capture Point Being Neutralized) OnPlayerEnterCapturePoint This will trigger when a Player enters a CapturePoint capturing area. Payloads: EventPlayer (Player Entering Capture Area), EventCapturePoint (Capture Point Being Entered) OnPlayerExitCapturePoint This will trigger when a Player exits a CapturePoint capturing area. Payloads: EventPlayer (Player Exiting Capture Area), EventCapturePoint (Capture Point Being Exited) OnMCOMArmed This will trigger when a MCOM is armed. Payloads: EventMCOM (Armed MCOM), EventPlayer (Player Who Armed) OnMCOMDefused This will trigger when a MCOM is defused. Payloads: EventMCOM (Defused MCOM), EventPlayer (Player Who Defused) OnMCOMDestroyed This will trigger when a MCOM is destroyed. Payloads: EventMCOM (Destroyed MCOM) OnPlayerDamaged This will trigger when a Player takes damage. Payloads: EventPlayer (Damaged Player), EventOtherPlayer (Damager Player), EventDamageType (Damage Type), EventWeapon (Damager Weapon) OnPlayerEarnKillAssist This will trigger when a Player earns a kill assist. _Payloads: EventPlayer (Assist Player), EventOtherPlayer (Victim)
title: Rule

Note: The redeploy time must be set to a value between 0 and 60 seconds.

Returns a sorted version of the specified Array given a Number value to sort by (ascending). CurrentArrayElement can be utilized to represent each value in the Array. In the following example, CurrentArrayElement is used to represent each Player in GetPlayers. GetGameModeScore is used with CurrentArrayElement to return the score, used as a rank, to sort the Array in ascending order.
Inputs Array Number (Rank) Output Array

body:
You can use this block to utilize text within your mod.
Team 2s Flag has been Captured!
A player has become the Juggernaut. Beware!
Phase 3 of your really cool custom mod has started!
Note: It’s your responsibility to ensure a safe and fair experience for others, violating the EA User Agreement by using offensive or inappropriate text may result in account bans.
title: String

body:
SUBROUTINE blocks are special blocks that are similar to RULE blocks, but do not have a designated EVENT. A SUBROUTINE block’s ACTIONS will be executed when called from the RULE block. Like RULE blocks, SUBROUTINE blocks can have a CONDITION to determine whether or not the ACTIONS inside should execute.
An important note is payload values, including EventPlayer, EventOtherPlayer, and EventTeam, use the context of the RULE block in which the SUBROUTINE instance block is placed in. An example of this would be, if your RULE block has an instance of EventPlayer, and the SUBROUTINE is called in OnPlayerDeployed, it would use the EventPlayer associated with OnPlayerDeployed. Be careful with this, as you will run into errors if your SUBROUTINE is placed inside a RULE block with non-existant payloads for that EVENT.
title: SUBROUTINE

body: Calls a SUBROUTINE block of the same name.
title: subroutineInstanceBlock

body:
Gradually modifies the value of a Variable at a specified rate (value/second) until it reaches the provided limit.
Note: If the limit is changed later, the Variable will continue to be updated from its previous value. To spot modifying the Variable, use StopTrackingVariable.
Inputs Variable Number (Limit) Number (Rate)
title: TrackVariableAtRate

body:
Gradually modifies the value of a Variable over time (in seconds). The variable’s value will reach the limit at the end of the interval.
Note: If the limit is changed later, the Variable will continue to be updated from its previous value. To spot modifying the Variable, use StopTrackingVariable.
Inputs Variable Number (Limit) Number (Interval)
title: TrackVariableOverTime

This block is used to reference a Variable instance. The Variable can be selected by setting the scope - Global , Player, or Team - in the first dropdown, and then selecting the Variable name in the second dropdown.
Variable instances can be created or deleted by clicking on the Variables tab, and clicking on Manage Variables.
